major_arcana.name: The Fool
major_arcana.upright_meaning: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, free spirit, adventure
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Recklessness, risk-taking, inconsideration, foolishness
major_arcana.description: The Fool represents new beginnings, innocence, and the start of a journey. It symbolizes taking a leap of faith and embracing the unknown with childlike wonder.

major_arcana.name: The Magician
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action, skill
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents, lack of resources
major_arcana.description: The Magician represents the power to manifest your desires through focused will and skill. It's about taking action and using your talents effectively.

major_arcana.name: The High Priestess
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, subconscious mind
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal, silence
major_arcana.description: The High Priestess represents intuition, inner knowledge, and the mysteries of the subconscious. She encourages you to trust your inner voice.

major_arcana.name: The Empress
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Fertility, nurturing, abundance, sensuality, nature, beauty
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Creative block, dependence on others, emptiness, lack of growth
major_arcana.description: The Empress represents abundance, nurturing energy, and creative fertility. She embodies the power of nature and the divine feminine.

major_arcana.name: The Emperor
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Authority, structure, control, fatherhood, stability, power
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Domination, excessive control, rigidity, inflexibility
major_arcana.description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and control. He embodies leadership, stability, and the power to create order from chaos.

major_arcana.name: The Hierophant
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Tradition, conformity, morality, ethics, education, guidance
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Questioning beliefs, unconventionality, rebellion, personal beliefs
major_arcana.description: The Hierophant represents tradition, conformity, and spiritual guidance. He represents established institutions and conventional wisdom.

major_arcana.name: The Lovers
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Love, harmony, relationships, choices, alignment of values
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values, discord
major_arcana.description: The Lovers represent love, harmony, and important choices. They symbolize the alignment of values and the power of love to unite.

major_arcana.name: The Chariot
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Control, willpower, victory, determination, success, action
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Lack of control, lack of direction, aggression, defeat
major_arcana.description: The Chariot represents control, willpower, and victory through determination. It symbolizes the triumph of will over obstacles.

major_arcana.name: Strength
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Strength, courage, patience, control, compassion, influence
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Inner strength, self-doubt, low energy, raw emotion
major_arcana.description: Strength represents inner strength, courage, and patience. It's about controlling your emotions and finding power through gentleness.

major_arcana.name: The Hermit
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Introspection, solitude, guidance, inner wisdom, soul searching
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Isolation, loneliness, withdrawal, rejection
major_arcana.description: The Hermit represents introspection, solitude, and the search for inner wisdom. He guides you to look within for answers.

major_arcana.name: Wheel of Fortune
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Change, cycles, fate, turning point, karma, destiny
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Bad luck, resistance to change, breaking cycles, lack of control
major_arcana.description: The Wheel of Fortune represents change, cycles, and the turning points in life. It reminds us that life is constantly in motion.

major_arcana.name: Justice
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Justice, fairness, truth, cause and effect, law, balance
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Unfairness, lack of accountability, dishonesty, imbalance
major_arcana.description: Justice represents fairness, truth, and the balance of cause and effect. It's about accountability and making fair decisions.

major_arcana.name: The Hanged Man
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Surrender, letting go, new perspective, enlightenment, sacrifice
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Stalling, needless sacrifice, fear of sacrifice, stalling
major_arcana.description: The Hanged Man represents surrender, letting go, and seeing things from a new perspective. It's about sacrifice for greater understanding.

major_arcana.name: Death
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Endings, change, transformation, transition, letting go
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Resistance to change, inability to move on, stagnation, decay
major_arcana.description: Death represents endings, change, and transformation. It's about letting go of the old to make way for the new.

major_arcana.name: Temperance
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Balance, moderation, patience, purpose, meaning, alignment
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Imbalance, excess, lack of harmony, hastiness
major_arcana.description: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and patience. It's about finding harmony and purpose in life.

major_arcana.name: The Devil
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Shadow self, attachment, addiction, restriction, sexuality
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Releasing limiting beliefs, exploring dark thoughts, detachment
major_arcana.description: The Devil represents the shadow self, attachments, and limiting beliefs. It's about recognizing what holds us back.

major_arcana.name: The Tower
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Sudden change, upheaval, chaos, revelation, awakening
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Fear of change, avoiding disaster, delaying the inevitable
major_arcana.description: The Tower represents sudden change, upheaval, and revelation. It's about breaking down old structures to build new ones.

major_arcana.name: The Star
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Hope, faith, purpose, renewal, spirituality, inspiration
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Lack of faith, despair, disconnection, discouragement
major_arcana.description: The Star represents hope, faith, and spiritual renewal. It brings inspiration and guidance in dark times.

major_arcana.name: The Moon
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Illusion, fear, anxiety, subconscious, intuition, mystery
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Release of fear, repressed emotion, inner confusion, clarity
major_arcana.description: The Moon represents illusion, fear, and the subconscious mind. It reveals hidden truths and inner fears.

major_arcana.name: The Sun
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Positivity, fun, warmth, success, vitality, joy
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Inner child, feeling down, overly optimistic, pessimism
major_arcana.description: The Sun represents positivity, joy, and success. It brings warmth, vitality, and the energy of the inner child.

major_arcana.name: Judgement
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Judgement, rebirth, inner calling, absolution, awakening
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Self-doubt, inner critic, ignoring the call, self-judgement
major_arcana.description: Judgement represents rebirth, inner calling, and spiritual awakening. It's about answering your higher purpose.

major_arcana.name: The World
major_arcana.upright_meaning: Completion, integration, accomplishment, travel, wholeness
major_arcana.reversed_meaning: Lack of completion, lack of closure, delay, imperfection
major_arcana.description: The World represents completion, integration, and wholeness. It symbolizes the successful completion of a journey.

wands.name: Ace of Wands
wands.upright_meaning: Creation, willpower, inspiration, desire, new opportunities
wands.reversed_meaning: Lack of energy, lack of passion, delays, missed opportunities
wands.description: The Ace of Wands represents new creative opportunities and the spark of inspiration. It's about taking action on your ideas.

wands.name: Two of Wands
wands.upright_meaning: Planning, making decisions, leaving comfort zone, discovery
wands.reversed_meaning: Fear of unknown, playing safe, bad planning, overanalysis
wands.description: The Two of Wands represents planning and making important decisions. It's about stepping out of your comfort zone.

cups.name: Ace of Cups
cups.upright_meaning: New feelings, spirituality, intuition, love, compassion
cups.reversed_meaning: Emotional loss, blocked creativity, emptiness, lack of inspiration
cups.description: The Ace of Cups represents new emotional beginnings and spiritual awakening. It brings love and compassion.

cups.name: Two of Cups
cups.upright_meaning: Unity, partnership, connection, mutual attraction, understanding
cups.reversed_meaning: Broken relationships, disharmony, distrust, lack of support
cups.description: The Two of Cups represents unity, partnership, and deep connection. It symbolizes mutual understanding and attraction.

swords.name: Ace of Swords
swords.upright_meaning: Breakthrough, clarity, sharp mind, new ideas, triumph
swords.reversed_meaning: Lack of clarity, confusion, brutality, chaos
swords.description: The Ace of Swords represents mental clarity and breakthrough insights. It brings sharp thinking and new ideas.

swords.name: Two of Swords
swords.upright_meaning: Difficult decisions, indecision, stalemate, blocked emotions
swords.reversed_meaning: Release of tension, indecision, confusion, no right choice
swords.description: The Two of Swords represents difficult decisions and inner conflict. It's about finding balance between opposing forces.

pentacles.name: Ace of Pentacles
pentacles.upright_meaning: New financial opportunity, physical opportunity, manifestation
pentacles.reversed_meaning: Missed opportunity, scarcity mindset, lack of planning
pentacles.description: The Ace of Pentacles represents new financial and physical opportunities. It's about manifesting abundance in the material world.

pentacles.name: Two of Pentacles
pentacles.description: The Two of Pentacles represents balance and adaptability. It's about managing multiple priorities effectively.

card_types.major_arcana: The Major Arcana consists of 22 cards that represent major life themes and spiritual lessons. These cards deal with significant life events and deep spiritual matters.
card_types.minor_arcana: The Minor Arcana consists of 56 cards divided into four suits: Wands (fire), Cups (water), Swords (air), and Pentacles (earth). These cards deal with everyday matters and practical concerns.

suits.wands: Wands represent the element of fire and deal with creativity, passion, energy, and spiritual matters.
suits.cups: Cups represent the element of water and deal with emotions, relationships, intuition, and matters of the heart.
suits.swords: Swords represent the element of air and deal with thoughts, communication, challenges, and mental clarity.
suits.pentacles: Pentacles represent the element of earth and deal with material matters, finances, work, and physical health.

reading_types.single_card: A single card reading provides quick insight into a specific question or situation.
reading_types.three_card: A three-card reading offers past, present, and future perspectives on a situation.
reading_types.celtic_cross: A comprehensive ten-card spread that provides detailed insight into complex situations.
reading_types.horseshoe: A seven-card spread that offers guidance on timing and progression of events.
reading_types.daily_draw: A single card drawn daily for guidance and reflection.
